content: luti hood anna dębska the luti hood is a unisex one-size pattern with loose fit notes designed for adults it features brioche stitch colour accents on the ribbings and an i-cord drawstring the hood is knitted bottom up starting with 1x1 ribbing in construction the round then brioche stitch is worked in the round for the neck part after binding off some stitches the rest of the hood is worked flat along with brioche decreases for shaping around the face and at the top back three-needle bind off is used to close the hood at the top next stitches are picked up around the front opening to work 1x1 ribbed brim then double folded i-cord string is worked separately and then placed inside the brim sandnes garn double sunday kroopa wool or any other yarn dk weight yarn 50 g/100 m 350 m 383 yd of main colour 26 m 28 yd of contrast colour circular needles 4 mm us 6 40 cm 16 in needles additional 4 mm us 6 needle for three-needle bind off 15 sts ✕ 42 row 21 visible knit sts = 10 cm / 4 in in gauge brioche stitch on 4 mm needles a - 41 cm 16 in finished b - 70 cm 27 ½ in measurements luti hood by anna dębska 2 instructions ribbing co 118 sts using tubular or long-tail cast on pm for bor and join in the round work ribbing changing between main and contrast colour yarn as follows round 1-7 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc round 8-9 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using cc round 10-13 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc round 14-15 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using cc round 16-23 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc do not break yarn work the rest of the hood with main colour yarn neck when there is a colour stripe worked in the round a slight shift is produced at the beginning of the round to place it in a less visible place at the back of the hood half of the round is worked before establishing brioche pattern in order to change the placement of the beginning of the round if you are making a unicolour hood you can omit this step changing bor round rm *k1 p1* repeat 35 times work 70 stitches pm for new bor to establish brioche pattern work the following set-up round keep in mind that in brioche stitch you have to work two rounds/row to create one visible row of stitches set-up round *k1 sl1yo* repeat to end of round continue as follows round 1 *sl1yo brp1* repeat to end of round round 2 *brk1 sl1yo* repeat to end of round work rounds 1 and 2 nine times in total luti hood by anna dębska 3 hood round 1 *sl1yo brp1* repeat until there are 20 sts left before marker bobble loosely remaining sts before marker rm
